title: Edward B. Quinn, PhD, MPH
text: I am a Data Scientist and a published health researcher. My PhD training was in epigenetics and health equity, where I used R to analyze over 400 million data points. In my spare time, I love to travel and watch mixed martial arts.

title: Using Virtual Environments in Python
text:
Make sure you are in the directory where you want to create a virtual environment.
Use the following code: python -m venv .venv
Activate the virtual environment using .\.venv\Scripts\activate
pip install whatever it is you need to install.
Export dependencies by using pip freeze >> requirements.txt
Deactivate the virtual environment by using deactivate
Make sure to add .venv to your .gitignore file before committing.





Pull the repo from github
Create a new virtual environment as described above.
Use the requirements.txt to file to recreate the virtual environment like so: pip install -r requirements.txt.
